errCodes: PXERR_MSG_NOT_IMPLEMENTED - function is called by a system interrupt handler

description.short: Get the metadata of the message

long.text: The PxMsgGetMetadata_Hnd returns the metadata of the message. The size of the metadata is 8 byte. This function should only be called from handlers running in a taskâ€™s context.

BeforeCall: `msgid` must be a valid message object, requested via `PxMsgRequest...` or `PxMsgEnvelop...` or received by a `PxMsgReceive...` call (V). This message object may be checked with one of the following macros:
- `PxMsgIdError()` must be `PXERR_NOERROR` otherwise the returned error code has to be interpreted \(C).
AfterCall: `PxMsgGetMetadata_Hnd` returns a null value on failure \(C).
BestPractice: This function should be called from handlers only. (V)
